page.title: 04THE AMBULANCE SERVICE
page.content:
The work mostly done is the transport of patients to out-patient and fracture clinics, physiotherapy, admissions and discharges to hospitals and transfers between hospitals.
Many patients are transported to geriatric day-care centres and physiotherapy clinics. Most ambulances are employed on this routine work during the day except when emergency cases occur.
All ambulance work is organised from Belle Vue control. The new Pye radios are computerised to aid efficiency of communication and to lessen the paper work. In the Stockport area the main station is on Heaton Lane with sub-stations at Cheadle and Hazel Grove. Ambulances are Crown Vehicles and as such do not pay road tax.
